name: Avoid creating cookie with overly broad path (TypeScript)
description: This rule checks that the cookies do not have an overly broad path, such as the root context path ("/").
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
If read access is not properly restricted, then attackers can steal sensitive information. If write access is not properly restricted, then attackers can modify and possibly delete the data, causing incorrect results and possibly a denial of service.

Cookies with an overly broad path, such as the root context path ("/"), can be accessed by all web applications on the same domain name. A cookie with sensitive data, but with too broad a path, could hence be read and tampered by a less secure and untrusted application.
remediation: Do not provide a root path
remediationSample:
// specifc path is recommended 
document.cookie = "name=test; path=/admin; secure";
sample:
// root path is not recommended 
document.cookie = "name=test; path=/; secure";
total: Number of TypeScript artifacts assigning document.cookie
alternativeName: Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie path
